author.bio: Unironic Anarcho-Monarchist. I also collect stamps.

body:
This newspaper clipping is from the *Edinburg Daily Courier*, dated 29th of October, 1938 (that's not a typo, it was a newspaper for Edinburg, Indiana). This means that Mihail Toloto lived from 1856 to 1938. The name suggests that he was of Serbian or Romanian origin. His last name is sometimes given as "Tolotos", presumably under the assumption that it was a Greek name. 

As pointed out by others, the photo is of Brother Nathanael, who is very much alive right now. 

That being, imagine this monk dying, and the first woman he ever sees is the Blessed Mother of God, the greatest woman in the entire world!
body_html:
This newspaper clipping is from the Edinburg Daily Courier, dated 29th of October, 1938 (that's not a typo, it was a newspaper for Edinburg, Indiana). This means that Mihail Toloto lived from 1856 to 1938. The name suggests that he was of Serbian or Romanian origin. His last name is sometimes given as "Tolotos", presumably under the assumption that it was a Greek name.

As pointed out by others, the photo is of Brother Nathanael, who is very much alive right now.

That being, imagine this monk dying, and the first woman he ever sees is the Blessed Mother of God, the greatest woman in the entire world!

parent.body:
This newspaper clipping is from the *Edinburg Daily Courier*, dated 29th of October, 1938 (that's not a typo, it was a newspaper for Edinburg, Indiana). This means that Mihail Toloto lived from 1856 to 1938. The name suggests that he was of Serbian or Romanian origin. His last name is sometimes given as "Tolotos", presumably under the assumption that it was a Greek name. 

As pointed out by others, the photo is of Brother Nathanael, who is very much alive right now. 

That being, imagine this monk dying, and the first woman he ever sees is the Blessed Mother of God, the greatest woman in the entire world!
parent.body_html:
This newspaper clipping is from the Edinburg Daily Courier, dated 29th of October, 1938 (that's not a typo, it was a newspaper for Edinburg, Indiana). This means that Mihail Toloto lived from 1856 to 1938. The name suggests that he was of Serbian or Romanian origin. His last name is sometimes given as "Tolotos", presumably under the assumption that it was a Greek name.

As pointed out by others, the photo is of Brother Nathanael, who is very much alive right now.

That being, imagine this monk dying, and the first woman he ever sees is the Blessed Mother of God, the greatest woman in the entire world!

body: I do. Most children do for their first few years. People can't remember their childhoods because of massive brain reorganization causing amnesia, it's basically like getting completely a new brain. It's not because children and babies aren't conscious before that.
body_html: I do. Most children do for their first few years. People can't remember their childhoods because of massive brain reorganization causing amnesia, it's basically like getting completely a new brain. It's not because children and babies aren't conscious before that.

body:
[Here is a real picture of the monk. It's a true story.](https://img.mensxp.com/media/content/2016/Apr/the-story-of-the-man-who-lived-and-died-without-ever-seeing-a-woman1-1461850391.jpg?w=640&h=361)

Idk why it's so hard to find on the internet.  Google gives you this guy named Nathaniel and some random Buddhist monk for some reason.

Here is a real picture of the monk. It's a true story.
